page.title: 18Poetry (page17 continued)
page.content: {How I loved to work the bellows, { while he forged a horse's shoe. { { I see runner Tom McCormick, { winning in the hundred yards, { at the Sports Committee's meeting, { in "The Holm" near Ballyards. { { I remember big Bob Morgan, { On the rope at tug-of war, { and while Bob was set at anchor, { none could pull his team-mates far. { { Then I see the village gardens, { clothed in blossoms rich and rare, { and I hear the judge's verdict, { "Hand the prize to Jimmy Blair." { While my dream is slowly fading, { and as time exacts it's toll, { all these old familiar faces, { bring contentment to my soul. { }
